metadata.case_name: Managing Committee T. K. Ghoshs Academy & Ors. v. [Sons of Shri Jadu Nath Palit]

facts.text: Shri Jadu Nath Palit founded T. K. Ghoshs Academy in 1876 in premises originally belonging to Mr. Boilard.
Shri Jadu Nath Palit died in 1901 leaving three minor sons: two plaintiff-respondents and Dr. K. Palit.
Management of school looked after by sons of Shri T. K. Ghosh (brother-in-law of Jadu Nath) after his death; Managing Committee formed in 1905-1906.
Near 1914, management taken over by Jadu Nath's sons; reformed in 1918-19 under Board of Secondary Education.
School building purchased by three sons of Jadu Nath from Mr. Boilard per sale deed Ex.C.
Dr. K. L. Palit sold his share in school building to two brothers (plaintiff-respondents) per sale deed Ex.C1.

Two plaintiff-respondents executed Deed of Trust Ex.P appointing Rai Bahadur Nirmal Chandra Ghosh and six others as trustees; transferred school name, goodwill, funds, furniture, library, equipments (excluding land/building); trustees to shift school within 5 years, pay Rs.250/pm rent for 5 years, start building fund; at least one male descendant of Jadu Nath to be trustee if available.
School building on holding No.20; extended to No.22 in 1951 (upper for headmaster, lower for classes).
Agreed rent Rs.37/8/- for holding No.22; total rent Rs.287/8/- (Rs.250 for No.20 + Rs.37/8/-).
June 1956: Settled that Rs.190/- paid directly to plaintiffs, balance Rs.97/8/- by Managing Committee to trustees for taxes/repairs.
Premises not vacated within 5 years of Deed of Trust.
Suit filed by plaintiff-respondents against Board of Trustees and others for ejectment and Rs.7,163/12/3 arrears from Aug 1956 to July 1959.
Trial court (Additional Sub Judge Patna): Decreed ejectment and Rs.7,163/12/3; held Deed of Trust genuine/valid, landlord-tenant relationship via Deed.
Appeal by some defendants (No.2,3,7,12 as Managing Committee members); trustees did not contest.
Patna High Court (29 Sep 1967, Appeal from Original Decree No.459/1961): Set aside ejectment (no s.106 TP Act notice), reduced decree to Rs.3,725/2/-; rejected dedication, upheld landlord-tenant.
Appeal to SC on certificate under Art.133(1)(a)&(b).
Till 1950 Deed, school treated as proprietary school of plaintiff-respondents (inspection note 1947, annual statement 1950).
Trustees resolved (1951-05-21, 1952-04-20) to acquire land/build building as school had no own building.
Managing Committee received govt deficit grants based on statements showing house rent Rs.250 + Rs.37.50 pm.
Managing Committee resolution 1954-12-23 admitted rent Rs.287.50 pm including headmaster portion.
Audit report Apr-Oct 1956 mentioned rent Rs.287.50.

legal_issues.text: Whether certificate of fitness for appeal to SC under Art.133(1)(b) valid, as HC judgment did not affirm trial court and involved claim re property >Rs.20,000.
Whether relationship of landlord and tenant existed between plaintiff-respondents and school/Managing Committee, imposing rent liability.
Whether Deed of Trust valid and binding, or fraudulent/illusory.
Whether school building dedicated by founder for public use without rent liability.
Maintainability of ejectment without notice u/s 106 TP Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: No landlord-tenant relationship; no contract for rent Rs.287/8/- pm; Deed of Trust fraudulent, illusory, void.
School founded by plaintiffs' father for public good/education uplift; building dedicated for public use.
Certificate valid only under Art.133(1)(b), not (a).

respondent_arguments.text: HC erred in granting certificate; seek cancellation.
Landlord-tenant via Deed of Trust; rent Rs.287/8/- agreed; arrears due.

court_reasoning.text: Certificate valid under Art.133(1)(b) as HC judgment not affirmation of trial court (set aside ejectment, reduced amount); involves claim/question re school premises property >Rs.20,000 (not subject-matter value <Rs.20,000).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Distinction between cl.(a) subject-matter and cl.(b) claim re property; HC variation not affirmance per Tirumalachetti.

court_reasoning.text: School proprietary till 1950 Deed; Deed transferred assets excluding building; trustees to shift/pay rent.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Evidence of rent: govt grants on rent basis, MC resolution 1954, audit report.

court_reasoning.text: No force in no-rent liability contention; uphold HC money decree Rs.3,725/2/- .
court_reasoning.key_observation: School received grants representing rent payment; MC admitted rent.

holdings.text: Appeal maintainable under Art.133(1)(b); certificate not cancelled.
Landlord-tenant relationship exists; rent liability Rs.287/8/- pm proved; no interference with HC money decree.

precedents_cited.case_name: Tirumalachetti Rajaram v. Tirumalachetti Radhakrishnayya Chetty
precedents_cited.relevance: HC judgment not affirmance if varies trial decree, regardless of favour.

precedents_cited.case_name: Chhitarmal v. M/s Shah Pannalal Chandulal
precedents_cited.relevance: Cl.(b) applies to claim re property other/additional to subject-matter.

precedents_cited.case_name: Surapati Roy Ors. v. Ram Narayan Mukherji Ors.
precedents_cited.relevance: Certificate valid for recurring liability re property >appealable value.

precedents_cited.case_name: Bombay Gas Co. Ltd. v. Jagan Nath Pandurang Anr.
precedents_cited.relevance: No claim re property >Rs.20,000; mere recurring wages not sufficient.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Criteria for certificate of fitness for SC appeal.

statutes_cited.name: Transfer of Property Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Notice required to determine tenancy for ejectment (upheld by HC).

outcome.summary: Dismissed application to cancel certificate; upheld HC decree for recovery of Rs.3,725/2/- on rent arrears; no interference mentioned re ejectment set aside by HC.
outcome.relief_granted: Money decree Rs.3,725/2/- in favour of respondents upheld.

key_quotes.text: "the school receives grant from the Government on the representation that an amount of Rs. 287.50 has to be paid on account of house rent, it hardly lies in the mouth of the appellants to assert that there is no liability for the payment of rent"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects no-rent contention based on conduct.

key_quotes.text: "in determining the character of the appellate decree we have to look at the appellate decree taken in its entirety and compare it with the decision of the trial court as a whole and decide whether the appellate decree is one of affirmance or not."
key_quotes.speaker: court
